definition: to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods

sentences.english: The light perceived by the human eye is measured in units called lumen-hours.
sentences.chinese: 人类眼睛所观测到的光是以流明小时这种单位度量的。

sentences.english: What are the delivered lumens per watt (LPW) to the actual required application?
sentences.chinese: 对于实际的需求，每瓦需要多少流明？

sentences.english: In many situations, 621 lumens is too bright.
sentences.chinese: 在许多情况下，621流明太亮。

sentences.english: Lumen Depreciation is the decrease in lumen output that occurs as a lamp operates.
sentences.chinese: 流明衰减发生在灯泡点亮过程中流明输出的减少。

sentences.english: The number of lumens a bulb produces for each watt it consumes.
sentences.chinese: 一个灯管消耗每单位瓦特所产生的流明数。

sentences.english: The range of lumen output on the AX100U is exceptional.
sentences.chinese: 范围流明输出的AX100U是非同寻常的。

sentences.english: If you calculate 1000 lumens for 1m2 than your plants will be happy.
sentences.chinese: 如果你计算1000流明平方米，比你的植物会快乐。

sentences.english: Compare this with a typical halogen light which is 1400 lumens , and you'll see the point.
sentences.chinese: 比较典型卤素光这是1400流明，你会看到这一点。

sentences.english: The lamp has a light output of up to 950 lumens.
sentences.chinese: 这个灯有一个输出量达到950流明的灯头。

definition: contrast (balance of black and white in TV screen setup)/degree of contrast
